attributes.action: reject proposals to extend the school-leaving age to 18
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
This 'big idea' is fundamentally flawed.  The government’s aim of improving the overall skills level of the UK workforce is laudable but it will not be achieved by keeping disaffected young people in school by an act of compulsion.

Those who wish to continue their education have plentiful opportunities and, through Educational Maintenance Allowances, financial inducements.  Those who reject these opportunities and inducements clearly do so because they are not motivated to continue.  Motivation to learn will not come by legal compulsion.  If compulsion is introduced, schools, colleges and training providers will become institutions forced to offer worthless  and wasteful time-serving.
